author: travelandtourworld.com
title: Explosion unnerve pilgrimage tourism hotspot in Bangkok; 12 dead - Travelandtourworld.comTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Explosion unnerve pilgrimage tourism hotspot in Bangkok; 12 dead Published on : Monday, August 17, 2015
Bomb blast in the Thai capital Bangkok kills 12 and almost 20 people have been reported to be injured. The attack took place close to the Erawan Shrine in the capitalâ€™s central Chidlom district. The blast took place just after 7pm local time in Ratchaprasong, a road intersection and shopping district near the Erawan Shrine.
Eyewitnesses claim they have seen bodies in the street, with emergency services flooding to the scene at Erawan Shrine after a bomb was detonated. Images shared on social media have shown destruction of the surrounding area, and bodies lying dead in the street.
Emergency alert had already been generated. Officers are warning people at the scene that there could be another bomb, and to evacuate the area.
The Erawan shrine, on a busy corner near top hotels, shopping centres and offices, is a major tourist attraction, especially for visitors from East Asia. The Erawan is popular shrine to the Hindu god Brahma but is visited by thousands of Buddhist devotees every day, as well as tourists.
